result.execSummary:
The defendant Wade N. Rudoll was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: The Court orders that: Upon deposit of $105.00 and current address information the, the Defendant be released from custody , on the above mentioned case(s).  The Defendant shall pay the remaining balance, plus interest and a $15.00 payment plan fee, at the rate of $35.00/month commencing 01/31/2017.  25% annual increase of monthly payments shall be implemented.  Civil judgment and referral to the WI DOR, shall remain.  Any failure to comply with this payment order shall result in the re-imposition of the failure to pay sentence without further notice of hearing.

Case called at 8:43am [mo]
Defendant Wade N. Rudoll in court, in custody with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon questioning of the Court, Counsel indicates they have no factual changes or corrections to make within the Revocation Summary

ADA Shock gives sentencing recommendations
Atty. Svehlek gives sentencing recommendations
Statement made by Mr. Rudoll

The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 6 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for purposes of employment and counseling; to commence FORTHWITH
--20 days credit for time already served given
--Mr. Rudoll is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--to pay outstanding court obligations, which the Court totaled to be $443. This amount is to be paid in $35 per month installments commencing on 9/30/15 and on the last day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a 10  day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

The Court instructs Mr. Rudoll to write the Court shall he become unable to pay the court costs.

recess: 9:08
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 08-13-2015 08:30 am
With elements/JI's and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Cases 15CF49 and 15CM111 called together at 1:48pm [mo]
Defendant Wade N. Rudoll in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of "Guilty" entered on Case 15CF49 Count #1 and Case 15CM111 Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

DA Happ submits Victim Impact Statement

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 and #3 of Case 15CF49.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Rudoll

On Case 15CF49  Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years

On Case 15CM111  Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, concurrent to 15CF49

Conditions of Probatio for Case 15CF49 and 15CM111:
--On Case 15CF49: to serve 4 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/work-release privileges and education, to commence on    12/1 /15 at 7:00 pm.
---Mr.Rudoll is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
--to undergo AODA assessment if required by Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or therapy as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--No contact with Justin Olson
--No presence at King Blunder Enterprises
--On Case 15CF49 to pay restitution to King Blunder Enterprises c/o Craig Lang in the amount of $1,350; joint and several with Justin Olson
--On Case 15CF49 to pay 10% restitution processing fee
--On Case 15CF49 Count #1: to pay costs of  $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge
--On Case 15CM111 Count #1: to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to submit DNA sample to designee upon demand 


--On Case 15CF49 Days credit for time already served:  2  days
--On Case 15CM111 Days credit for time already served:  0  days

[MK] case called at 10:10am. 
Defendant Wade N. Rudoll in court with Attorney Yelena O Zarwell.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Plea of "not guilty" is entered; speedy trial is waived by the Defense. 

The Court requires $1,000 signature bond, with conditions: 
--no presence at Havill Spoel which is located at 1121 S. Main Street in the City of Jefferson
--no presence at United Drilling which is located at 1417 Inudustrial Drive in Jefferson
--no to drive or haul any vehicle or trailer without valid permission from its owner
recess 10:14am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: of Judge

[MK] cases #15CF49 and #15CM111 called at 8:59am. 
Defendant Wade N. Rudoll in court with Attorney Yelena O Zarwell.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

In case #15CF49:
--Mr. Rudoll waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
--DA Happ files the Information.
--on agreement of counsel, and as an effort to coordinate the scheduling of the Co-Defendants' cases, the Court will schedule the case for Arraignment on the same date/time as the Co-Defendant's Preliminary Hearing 

In case #15CM111:
--service of Criminal Complaint admitted, reading waived
--Mr. Rudoll verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Complaint are accurate
--Attorney Zarwell requests that the Initial Appearance be adjourned
--the Court directs Attorney Zarwell to discuss the matter now with Mr. Rudoll, so that Initial Appearance can be completed today.
--recess 9:04am, reconvene 9:16am. 
--the Defense files a Motion for Substitution of Judge, which lists this case number only.
--The Court finds this is timely and in proper form. The Court direct the clerk to take action on it.
recess 9:16am 


NEXT IN CASE #15CF49:  schedule Arraignment on 4/28/15 at 10:30am;  also send Notice of Hearing to Co-Defendant Olson (Case #15CF48) modifying the 4/28/15 Hearing type from a Status Conference to a Preliminary Hearing, and modifying the time from 8:30am to 10:30am (so that the Co-Defendants cases can be called together) 


NEXT IN CASE #15CM111:  (1) Application for Judicial Assignment  (2) once newly-appointed judge is known, this case should be scheduled for Adjourned Initial Appearance
